topic: How can in situ liquid cell TEM be employed to directly visualize the real-time adsorption and structural changes of 2D MoS₂ nanosheets used in aqueous FET sensors during analyte binding? What fluid cell configurations and electron dose parameters are necessary to preserve native water–material interfaces while capturing high-resolution sensing events without beam-induced artifacts?

perspectives.perspective: Ultra-low-dose, high-speed liquid-cell STEM imaging of MoS2–analyte interactions
Electrochemical gating-integrated liquid-cell TEM for correlating adsorption with aqueous FET response
Computational–experimental data-integration framework for artifact mitigation and interpretation
